content: I suggest deleting the passwords for account. that is at account settings>privacy&security. - click saved passwords and then show passwords - highlight the rows for that specific account and delete them. - try signing in again.
creator: davidsk

content: I deleted the passwords and now it just hangs. I still get the popup and clicking on Allow doesn't do anything. At no time does it ask me for a password
creator: frankfileccia

content: You shouldn't see the 2nd picture with the password prompt if the authentication is OAuth2, but there might be an obsolete password in Saved Passwords. Remove all entries for the account in Settings/Privacy & Security, Saved Passwords, restart TB, enter the account password in the OAuth window to allow access. Check that the incoming authentication is also OAuth2.
creator: sfhowes

content: I am not sure of how to fix, as I am not clear on what the screenshot is showing. You might try clicking view>layout>message list header

content: For POP accounts, disable all the checking options in Account Settings, Server Settings. With IMAP accounts, the only way to stop notifications is usually to go offline (File/Offline/Work Offline or click the icon at the left end of the status bar).
creator: sfhowes

content: I can only offer two suggestions: - never place a filter below another where both refer to the same message - always use as many conditions as possible in a filter to ensure it selects only what is needed. I will agree that it's sometimes difficult to figure that out. :)
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you. Ideally my filters don't refer to the same message. My expectation was that I could first filter out messages from my friend (using his e-mail address as the criterion). I thought that would happen irrespective of Subject Line (which might sometimes be 'Lunch Club'). Then filter out other messages by Subject Line 'Lunch Club'. But it seems TB doesn't play ball! It moves them all according to the second filter.

content: try View>folder>folderpaneheader If menu bar is not visible, press alt key first. That will present the 'new message' button, assuming that is what you are referring to.

content: Threading has been the default since summer of 2022. Some like it, some don't. Although I have no such authority, I doubt that this will change anytime in near future. The link below gives full info on disabling it, plus details on how to set up Thunderbird in future with unthreading as the default. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1439822
creator: davidsk

content: To get suggested security settings, you need to advise of what your server settings are now.
